isis.stitle: 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS FULLER RT-610 SERIES - REASSEMBLE - MAINSHAFT

step1.para: Place the mainshaft in a vise with the pilot end up. Keep keyway in the mainshaft clear for insertion of the key.

note.para: Each mainshaft gear is held in position by locking the gear splined washer to the mainshaft with a key. There is one splined washer for each gear. Splined washers for the reverse, 1st, 2nd and 3rd speed gears are identical; the 4th speed gear splined washer is of smaller diameter.

step1.para: Install the reverse gear splined washer in the groove near the rear of the mainshaft.
Install the long key, from the top, in the keyway in the mainshaft to lock the reverse gears splined washer to mainshaft ( Figure 94).

figure.caption: Figure 94. Install Long Key in Keyway in Mainshaft

note.para: Make sure the long key is positioned with the word "top" on the key to the outside. During reassembly, the long key will be removed and re-installed to assure that the washers stay in position.

step1.para: Install the 1st-reverse clutch over the front of the mainshaft and against the reverse gear splined washer. Align the slot in the sliding clutch with the key ( Figure 95).

figure.caption: Figure 95. Install 1st-Reverse Clutch Over Front of Mainshaft

step1.para: Remove the long key from the keyway in the mainshaft.
Install 1st speed gear splined washer on the mainshaft at 1st speed gear location and re-install the long key to lock the splined washer to the shaft ( Figure 96).

figure.caption: Figure 96. Install 1st Speed Gear Splined Washer on Mainshaft

step1.para: Install 1st speed gear on the mainshaft, clutching teeth down, fitting the gear splines on those of the washer ( Figure 97).

figure.caption: Figure 97. Install 1st Speed Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: Install 2nd speed gear on the mainshaft, clutching teeth up, and against 1st speed gear ( Figure 98).

figure.caption: Figure 98. Install 2nd Speed Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: Remove the long key from the keyway in the mainshaft.
Install 2nd speed gear splined washer on the mainshaft and into the hub of 2nd speed gear ( (left, Figure 99).
Install the long key in the keyway in the mainshaft to lock the washer to the shaft ( (right, Figure 99).

figure.caption: Figure 99. Install 2nd Speed Gear Splined Washer and Install Long Key in Keyway

step1.para: Install 3rd speed gear splined washer on the mainshaft at 3rd speed gear location. It will be necessary to pull the long key upward slightly to fit the splined washer over the key cross pin and to fit the key in the keyway. Re-position the key so that the cross pin rests on top of the washer ( Figure 101). Inset shows the key and washer properly installed.

figure.caption: Figure 101. Install 3rd Speed Gear Splined Washer on Mainshaft

step1.para: Install 3rd speed gear on the mainshaft, fitting the gear splines on those of the washer ( Figure 102).

figure.caption: Figure 102. Install 3rd Speed Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: Install 4th speed gear on the mainshaft, clutching teeth up, and against 3rd speed gear ( Figure 103).

figure.caption: Figure 103. Install 4th Speed Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: Install 4th speed gear splined washer on the mainshaft and in the hub of 4th speed gear ( Figure 104).

figure.caption: Figure 104. Install 4th Speed Gear Splined Washer

step1.para: Install snap ring in the groove ( (inset, Figure 105) in the mainshaft which will hold the 4th speed gear in position on the shaft ( Figure 105).

figure.caption: Figure 105. Install Snap Ring in Groove

step1.para: Install 4th-5th speed sliding clutch on the mainshaft; place in engagement with 4th speed gear ( Figure 106).

Mark the timing teeth on the drive gear (5th speed gear). Mark two adjacent teeth on the drive gear. Mark the two adjacent teeth on the drive gear which are directly opposite the first set marked. There should be the same number of teeth between the markings on each side of the gear ( Figure 107).

figure.caption: Figure 107. Mark Timing Teeth on Drive Gear

step1.para: Install the drive gear on the mainshaft and against the 4th speed gear, snap ring groove in the drive gear to the front ( Figure 108).

figure.caption: Figure 108. Install Drive Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: Remove the assembly from the vise and install the reverse gear on the rear of the mainshaft, engaging the splines of the gear with those of the splined washer on the mainshaft ( Figure 109).

figure.caption: Figure 109. Install Reverse Gear on Rear of Mainshaft
